definition: to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: The school shall erect regulations to implement gender equity education, and promulgate them.
sentences.chinese: 学校应订定性别平等教育实施规定，并公告周知。

sentences.english: The possibility of the book being translated is provided for in your contract.
sentences.chinese: 在你们的合同中已订定有可能要翻译这本书。

sentences.english: Adoption or amendment of an internal control system pursuant to Article 14-1.
sentences.chinese: 依第十四条之一规定订定或修正内部控制制度。

sentences.english: The criteria of telecommunication numbers usage fees shall be enacted by the DGT.
sentences.chinese: 电信号码使用费之收费基准，由电信总局订定之。

sentences.english: Lomborg pretends otherwise because he disagrees with the priorities they set.
sentences.chinese: 隆伯格指鹿为马，只不过因为他反对别人订定的顺序。

sentences.english: Who should set the initial rate of statutory minimum wage?
sentences.chinese: 请问您认为谁应订定第一个最低工资金额？

sentences.english: I cannot end uplieve you on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，我不能订定你的意见。

sentences.english: Standardize and limit the number of drug concentrations available in the organization.
sentences.chinese: 限定医院内同一药品不同浓度之品项数并订定规范。

sentences.english: A toast to the plans we've made to live like kings.
sentences.chinese: 对我们已经订定住相似的国王的计划的一片土司面包。

sentences.english: The Academic Affairs Committee authorizes and enforces these policies and is also responsible for further revision.
sentences.chinese: 本办法由教务会议订定实施，修订时亦同。

sentences.english: An annual meeting is usually held in January to set new targets for that year.
sentences.chinese: 集团通常于每年一月举行年会，订定该年新的目标。

sentences.english: I cannot reingize you on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，我不能订定你的意见。

sentences.english: The scheme aims at helping students to set up their personal objectives of their university life and learning.
sentences.chinese: 签署约章的目的在协助同学订定大学生活及学习目标。

sentences.english: Comply with current Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) hand hygiene guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 遵从疾病管制局所订定的手部卫生指引。

sentences.english: I. The formation and alteration of the Constitution.
Yes, I think that's what we stipulated.
sentences.chinese: 对呀，我想那是我们所订定的。

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to lay down (a rule, a plan of action)/to draw up/booked out (i.e. already fully booked)
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to adopt (a system, policy, strategy etc)
to determine/to fix upon/to set (a target, a price etc)
to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
to weigh and consider/to deliberate/short form of idiom 衡情酌理
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
labor committee/abbr. for 勞動委員會|劳动委员会
